channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: New King in Saudi Arabia Unlikely to Alter Oil Policy
item.description: The death of King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia is unlikely to deter the nation’s high level of oil production despite the recent sharp drop in prices, analysts said.
item.dc:creator: By STANLEY REED and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
item.media:description: Saudi Arabia's new ruler, King Salman, said that the kingdom would not change course.

item.title: King Abdullah’s Successor Pledges Continuity in Saudi Arabia
item.description: King Salman was speaking as regional leaders shifted their schedules to attend what news reports said would be a simple and traditional burial.
item.dc:creator: By BEN HUBBARD
item.media:credit: Saudi Press Agency, via Associated Press
item.media:description: In this photograph released by the official news agency of Saudi Arabia, King Salman made his first speech after the death of King Abdullah on Friday in Riyadh.

item.title: Court Upholds France’s Move to Strip Citizenship of Man Jailed on Terror Charge
item.description: The Constitutional Council reviewed a challenge by the lawyer of a Moroccan-born man, Ahmed Sahnouni, who had become a French citizen in 2003.
item.dc:creator: By MAÏA de la BAUME

item.title: Ebola Infections Dropping in West Africa, World Health Organization Says
item.description: Officials said that there had been a substantial reduction in new cases, but that dwindling funds and the approaching rainy season were a problem.
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Protesters in Iran Condemn Charlie Hebdo Over Muhammad Cartoon
item.description: In cities across Iran, tens of thousands of people took to the streets to protest against the satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo for its cartoon of the Prophet Muhammad.
item.dc:creator: By THOMAS ERDBRINK

item.title: News Analysis: For King Salman, New Saudi Ruler, a Region in Upheaval
item.description: The king faces a list of foreign policy challenges that rival any a Saudi ruler has grappled with in decades, including in Yemen, Syria and Iran.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:description: King Salman during the funeral of the late King Abdullah.

item.title: King Abdullah, a Shrewd Force Who Reshaped Saudi Arabia, Dies at 90
item.description: Abdullah was one of the world’s wealthiest and most powerful men, but a cautious reformer amid great changes in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS MARTIN and BEN HUBBARD
item.media:description: King Abdullah of Saudi Arabia in 2007.

item.title: Rebels in Eastern Ukraine Vow to Drive Army From Donetsk
item.description: “We will attack,” said Aleksandr Zakharchenko, the leader of a Donetsk rebel group, seeking to build on the success of capturing a long-contested airport.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Israeli Arab Political Factions Join Forces to Keep Place in Parliament
item.description: Facing an electoral threshold that threatens to bar small parties from Parliament, the factions are forming a single ticket for the March elections.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Inequality as a Religious Issue: A Conversation With the Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: The Most Rev. Justin Welby speaks about income inequality, the recent terrorist attacks in Paris, divisions in the Church of England and Pope Francis.
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL PAULSON
item.media:description: The Most Rev. Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury, at Trinity Church in Manhattan on Thursday. He is in New York for a conference on inequality.

item.title: For Auschwitz Museum, and Survivors, a Moment of Passage
item.description: As the Auschwitz-Birkenau State Museum observes the 70th anniversary of the liberation of the concentration camps, it is focusing on new generations of visitors.
item.dc:creator: By RICK LYMAN
item.media:description: The former Nazi concentration camp at Auschwitz.

item.title: Obama Not Planning to Meet With Israeli Premier
item.description: When Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel visits the United States to lobby Congress for new sanctions that President Obama opposes, the two leaders will not meet, the White House said.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: President Obama with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in the Oval Office during a tense visit in 2011. The two leaders have clashed on issues like Israeli settlements.

item.title: Coeuré of E.C.B. Says ‘Stars Are Aligned’ for Stimulus Measures
item.description: Benoît Cœuré, a member of the central bank’s executive board, responded to criticism that the bond-buying plan came too late for the eurozone.
item.dc:creator: By JACK EWING

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Hong Kong Editor, Attacked Last Year, Expresses Hope for Future of News Media
item.description: Kevin Lau Chun-to, still using crutches and hobbling almost a year after he was attacked with a cleaver, said closer ties with mainland China came with great risks, but expressed hope for press freedom.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG
item.media:description: Kevin Lau Chun-to in January 2014, after his dismissal as editor of the Hong Kong newspaper Ming Pao.

item.title: Narendra Modi and President Obama to Meet in New Delhi
item.description: President Obama and Prime Minister Narendra Modi will discuss climate change, energy issues and business opportunities for American companies in India.
item.dc:creator: By NIDA NAJAR

item.title: Communist Leadership Approves Security Goals for China
item.description: The Politburo, a council of 25 senior officials, ratified a blueprint setting out national security priorities and warning that the country faced daunting dangers.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Yemen Government in Limbo Amid Uncertainty Over President’s Resignation
item.description: Houthi militiamen appeared to be consolidating their control, and there were reports that Parliament might reject the president’s resignation.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By MONA EL-NAGGAR and ROD NORDLAND
item.media:description: On Friday, Houthis carried the coffins of people killed during recent fighting against presidential guard forces in Sana, Yemen's capital.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Film Highlights Air Pollution’s Broad Reach
item.description: “Smog Journeys” follows the lives of two Chinese families: one a mining family in rural Hebei Province and the other a cosmopolitan family in hyper-urban Beijing.
item.dc:creator: By AMY QIN
item.media:description: A steel plant in the Handan area of Hebei Province, south of Beijing. A new film tries to show that all Chinese, regardless of socioeconomic status or geography, are affected by dirty air.

item.title: Japanese Hostage’s Mother Urges Islamic State to Spare Him
item.description: Junko Ishido, the mother of the journalist Kenji Goto, made her plea hours before a deadline for a $200 million ransom for Mr. Goto and another Japanese man.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MARTIN FACKLER
item.media:description: Junko Ishido, the mother of the journalist Kenji Goto, made her plea during a hastily organized news conference in Tokyo on Friday, just hours before a ransom deadline.

item.title: Editorial: Silencing Authors in India
item.description: Perumal Murugan is only the latest target of the cultural vigilantes.
item.dc:creator: By THE EDITORIAL BOARD
